intro: Arrojadoopsis, commonly known as the "Mexican sunflower," is a flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its showy, bright orange to red composite flowers. The plant typically grows as an annual herb with hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves. Arrojadoopsis thrives in full sun and well-drained soil, making it a popular choice for gardens and landscapes. Its botanical features make it both ornamental and ecologically beneficial, attracting pollinators like bees and butterflies.
